p: Poly (ADP-ribose) polymerases (PARPs) family is composed of 18 members which are involved in the bioprocesses, including DNA repair, cell cycle regulation, transcription, and so on [ 5, 6]. Abnormal expression of PARPs is correlated with necrotic cell death, cancer, and some inflammatory disorders [ 7]. PARP-1 activation has been regarded as one of the critic mechanisms underlying lung inflammation in the context of lipopolysaccharide (LPS) and elastase stimulations experimentally [ 8, 9]. Evidences indicated the abnormal increased expression of PARP-1 in non-pulmonary cells, alveolar epithelial cells, and lung tissue after IAV infection [ 10, 11], suggesting its potential as the target for the treatment of IAV infection. One of the PARP inhibitors, olaparib, is reported to ameliorate acute lung injury induced by elastase and LPS [ 9, 12]. Yet the role of olaparib on IAV-induced lung injury has rarely been reported. This study aimed to explore the effects of PARP inhibition by olaparib on IAV infection.
